member.name: T:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoBackupRequest
member.summary: Arango HotBackup request

member.name: P:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoBackupRequest.Label
member.summary: The label for this backup. The label is used together with a timestamp string create a unique backup identifier, {timestamp}_{label}. If no label is specified, the empty string is assumed and a default UUID is created for this part of the ID.

member.name: P:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoBackupRequest.Timeout
member.summary: The time in seconds that the operation tries to get a consistent snapshot. The default is 120 seconds.

member.name: P:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoBackupRequest.AllowInconsistent
member.summary: If this flag is set to true and no global transaction lock can be acquired within the given timeout, a possibly inconsistent backup is taken. The default for this flag is false and in this case a timeout results in an HTTP 408 error.

member.name: P:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoBackupRequest.Force
member.summary: If this flag is set to true and no global transaction lock can be acquired within the given timeout, all running transactions are forcefully aborted to ensure that a consistent backup can be created. This does not include JavaScript transactions. It waits for the transactions to be aborted at most timeout seconds. Thus using force the request timeout is doubled. To abort transactions is almost certainly not what you want for your application. In the presence of intermediate commits it can even destroy the atomicity of your transactions. Use at your own risk, and only if you need a consistent backup at all costs. The default and recommended value is false. If both allowInconsistent and force are set to true, then the latter takes precedence and transactions are aborted. This is only available in the cluster.

member.name: T:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoCollection
member.summary: Arango collection

member.name: P:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoCollection.Name
member.summary: The name of the collection.

member.name: P:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoCollection.Type
member.summary: The type of the collection to create.

member.name: P:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoCollection.IsSystem
member.summary: If true, create a system collection. In this case collection-name should start with an underscore. End users should normally create non-system collections only. API implementors may be required to create system collections in very special occasions, but normally a regular collection will do. (The default is false)

member.name: P:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoCollection.NumberOfShards
member.summary: (The default is 1): in a cluster, this value determines the number of shards to create for the collection. In a single server setup, this option is meaningless.

member.name: P:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoCollection.KeyOptions
member.summary: Additional options for key generation.

member.name: P:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoCollection.ShardKeys
member.summary: (The default is [ “_key” ]): in a cluster, this attribute determines which document attributes are used to determine the target shard for documents. Documents are sent to shards based on the values of their shard key attributes. The values of all shard key attributes in a document are hashed, and the hash value is used to determine the target shard. Note: Values of shard key attributes cannot be changed once set. This option is meaningless in a single server setup.

member.name: P:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoCollection.ReplicationFactor
member.summary: (The default is 1): in a cluster, this attribute determines how many copies of each shard are kept on different DB-Servers. The value 1 means that only one copy (no synchronous replication) is kept. A value of k means that k-1 replicas are kept. It can also be the string "satellite" for a SatelliteCollection, where the replication factor is matched to the number of DB-Servers (Enterprise Edition only).

member.name: P:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoCollection.ShardingStrategy
member.summary: This attribute specifies the name of the sharding strategy to use for the collection. Since ArangoDB 3.4 there are different sharding strategies to select from when creating a new collection. The selected shardingStrategy value will remain fixed for the collection and cannot be changed afterwards. This is important to make the collection keep its sharding settings and always find documents already distributed to shards using the same initial sharding algorithm. community-compat, enterprise-compat, enterprise-smart-edge-compat, hash, enterprise-hash-smart-edge

member.name: P:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoCollection.DistributeShardsLike
member.summary: (The default is ”“): in an Enterprise Edition cluster, this attribute binds the specifics of sharding for the newly created collection to follow that of a specified existing collection. Note: Using this parameter has consequences for the prototype collection. It can no longer be dropped, before the sharding-imitating collections are dropped. Equally, backups and restores of imitating collections alone will generate warnings (which can be overridden) about missing sharding prototype.

member.name: P:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoCollection.WriteConcern
member.summary: Write concern for this collection (default: 1). It determines how many copies of each shard are required to be in sync on the different DB-Servers. If there are less then these many copies in the cluster a shard will refuse to write. Writes to shards with enough up-to-date copies will succeed at the same time however. The value of writeConcern can not be larger than replicationFactor. (cluster only)

member.name: P:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoCollection.SmartJoinAttribute
member.summary: In an Enterprise Edition cluster, this attribute determines an attribute of the collection that must contain the shard key value of the referred-to SmartJoin collection. Additionally, the shard key for a document in this collection must contain the value of this attribute, followed by a colon, followed by the actual primary key of the document.

member.summary: Define if the created graph should be smart (Enterprise Edition only).

member.summary: Whether to create a Disjoint SmartGraph instead of a regular SmartGraph (Enterprise Edition only).

member.summary: JSON object to define options for creating collections within this graph. It can contain the following attributes:

member.name: T:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoGraphOptions
member.summary: Arango Graph Options

member.name: P:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoGraphOptions.SmartGraphAttribute
member.summary: Only has effect in Enterprise Edition and it is required if isSmart is true. The attribute name that is used to smartly shard the vertices of a graph. Every vertex in this SmartGraph has to have this attribute. Cannot be modified later.

member.name: P:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoGraphOptions.NumberOfShards
member.summary: The number of shards that is used for every collection within this graph. Cannot be modified later.

member.name: P:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoGraphOptions.ReplicationFactor
member.summary: The replication factor used when initially creating collections for this graph. Can be set to "satellite" to create a SatelliteGraph, which will ignore numberOfShards, minReplicationFactor and writeConcern (Enterprise Edition only).

member.name: P:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoGraphOptions.WriteConcern
member.summary: Write concern for new collections in the graph. It determines how many copies of each shard are required to be in sync on the different DB-Servers. If there are less then these many copies in the cluster a shard will refuse to write. Writes to shards with enough up-to-date copies will succeed at the same time however. The value of writeConcern can not be larger than replicationFactor. (cluster only)

member.name: T:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoIndex
member.summary: Arango index

member.name: P:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoIndex.Id
member.summary: The identifier of the index

member.name: P:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoIndex.Name
member.summary: Name of the index or null for auto generation

member.name: P:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoIndex.Type
member.summary: Type of the index

member.name: P:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoIndex.Fields
member.summary: (Hash | Skiplist) An array of attribute paths. (TTL | Fulltext) An array with exactly one attribute path. (Geo) An array with one or two attribute paths. If it is an array with one attribute path location, then a geo-spatial index on all documents is created using location as path to the coordinates. The value of the attribute must be an array with at least two double values. The array must contain the latitude (first value) and the longitude (second value). All documents, which do not have the attribute path or with value that are not suitable, are ignored. If it is an array with two attribute paths latitude and longitude, then a geo-spatial index on all documents is created using latitude and longitude as paths the latitude and the longitude. The value of the attribute latitude and of the attribute longitude must a double. All documents, which do not have the attribute paths or which values are not suitable, are ignored.

member.name: P:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoIndex.MinLength
member.summary: (Fulltext) Minimum character length of words to index. Will default to a server-defined value if unspecified. It is thus recommended to set this value explicitly when creating the index.

member.name: P:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoIndex.GeoJson
member.summary: (Geo) If a geo-spatial index on a location is constructed and geoJson is true, then the order within the array is longitude followed by latitude. This corresponds to the format described in http://geojson.org/geojson-spec.html#positions

member.name: P:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoIndex.Sparse
member.summary: (Hash | SkipList)

member.name: P:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoIndex.Unique
member.summary: (Hash | SkipList) Note: Unique indexes on non-shard keys are not supported in a cluster.

member.name: P:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoIndex.InBackground
member.summary: Indexes can also be created in “background”, not using an exclusive lock during the entire index creation. Background index creation might be slower than the “foreground” index creation and require more RAM.

member.name: P:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoIndex.Deduplicate
member.summary: (Hash | SkipList) Controls whether inserting duplicate index values from the same document into a unique array index will lead to a unique constraint error or not. The default value is true, so only a single instance of each non-unique index value will be inserted into the index per document. Trying to insert a value into the index that already exists in the index will always fail, regardless of the value of this attribute.

member.name: P:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoIndex.ExpireAfter
member.summary: (TTL) The time (in seconds) after a document’s creation after which the documents count as “expired”.

member.summary: Arango Index Type

member.name: F:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoIndexType.Skiplist

member.name: T:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoKeyOptions
member.summary: Arango collection key generating options

member.name: P:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoKeyOptions.Type
member.summary: Specifies the type of the key generator.

member.name: P:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoKeyOptions.AllowUserKeys
member.summary: If set to true, then it is allowed to supply own key values in the _key attribute of a document. If set to false, then the key generator will solely be responsible for generating keys and supplying own key values in the _key attribute of documents is considered an error.

member.name: P:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoKeyOptions.Increment
member.summary: increment value for autoincrement key generator. Not used for other key generator types.

member.name: P:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoKeyOptions.Offset
member.summary: Initial offset value for autoincrement key generator. Not used for other key generator types.

member.name: T:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoKeyType
member.summary: Arango key generation type

member.name: F:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoKeyType.Traditional
member.summary: The traditional key generator generates numerical keys in ascending order.

member.name: F:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoKeyType.Autoincrement
member.summary: The autoincrement key generator generates numerical keys in ascending order, the initial offset and the spacing can be configured

member.name: F:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoKeyType.Uuid
member.summary: The uuid key generator generates universally unique 128 bit keys, which are stored in hexadecimal human-readable format. This key generator can be used in a single-server or cluster to generate “seemingly random” keys. The keys produced by this key generator are not lexicographically sorted.

member.name: F:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoKeyType.Padded
member.summary: The padded key generator generates keys of a fixed length (16 bytes) in ascending lexicographical sort order. This is ideal for usage with the RocksDB engine, which will slightly benefit keys that are inserted in lexicographically ascending order. The key generator can be used in a single-server or cluster

member.name: T:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoLinkProperty
member.summary: Arango View Link Property

member.name: P:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoLinkProperty.Analyzers
member.summary: A list of Analyzers, by name as defined via the Analyzers, that should be applied to values of processed document attributes. default: [ "identity" ]

member.name: P:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoLinkProperty.IncludeAllFields
member.summary: If set to true, then process all document attributes. Otherwise, only consider attributes mentioned in fields. Attributes not explicitly specified in fields will be processed with default link properties, i.e. {}.

member.name: P:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoLinkProperty.TrackListPositions
member.summary: If set to true, then for array values track the value position in arrays.

member.name: P:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoLinkProperty.StoreValues
member.summary: none: Do not store values with the view. id: Store information about value presence to allow use of the EXISTS() function

member.name: P:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoLinkProperty.Fields
member.summary: An object of fields that should be processed at each level of the document. Each key specifies the document attribute to be processed. Note that the value of includeAllFields is also consulted when selecting fields to be processed. It is a recursive data structure.

member.name: T:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoNgramStreamType
member.summary: N-gram stream type

member.name: F:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoNgramStreamType.Binary
member.summary: One byte is considered as one character (default)

member.name: F:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoNgramStreamType.Utf8
member.summary: one Unicode codepoint is treated as one character

member.name: T:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoOverwriteMode
member.summary: Requires ArangoDB 3.7

member.name: F:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoOverwriteMode.Ignore
member.summary: If a document with the specified _key value exists already, nothing will be done and no write operation will be carried out. The insert operation will return success in this case. This mode does not support returning the old document version using RETURN OLD. When using RETURN NEW, null will be returned in case the document already existed.

member.name: F:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoOverwriteMode.Replace
member.summary: If a document with the specified _key value exists already, it will be overwritten with the specified document value. This mode will also be used when no overwrite mode is specified but the overwrite flag is set to true.

member.name: F:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoOverwriteMode.Update
member.summary: If a document with the specified _key value exists already, it will be patched (partially updated) with the specified document value. The overwrite mode can be further controlled via the keepNull and mergeObjects parameters.

member.name: F:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoOverwriteMode.Conflict
member.summary: If a document with the specified _key value exists already, return a unique constraint violation error so that the insert operation fails. This is also the default behavior in case the overwrite mode is not set, and the overwrite flag is false or not set either.

member.summary: sets the message that will be used when validation fails.

member.name: T:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoSchemaLevel
member.summary: Arango schema validation level

member.name: F:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoSchemaLevel.None
member.summary: The rule is inactive and validation thus turned off.

member.name: F:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoSchemaLevel.New
member.summary: Only newly inserted documents are validated.

member.name: F:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoSchemaLevel.Moderate
member.summary: New and modified documents must pass validation, except for modified documents where the OLD value did not pass validation already. This level is useful if you have documents which do not match your target structure, but you want to stop the insertion of more invalid documents and prohibit that valid documents are changed to invalid documents.

member.name: F:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoSchemaLevel.Strict
member.summary: All new and modified document must strictly pass validation. No exceptions are made (default).

member.name: T:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoTransaction
member.summary: Arango JavaScript transaction

member.name: P:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoTransaction.AllowImplicit
member.summary: Allow reading from undeclared collections.

member.name: P:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoTransaction.Collections
member.summary: Collections must be a JSON object that can have one or all sub-attributes read, write or exclusive, each being an array of collection names or a single collection name as string. Collections that will be written to in the transaction must be declared with the write or exclusive attribute or it will fail, whereas non-declared collections from which is solely read will be added lazily. The optional sub-attribute allowImplicit can be set to false to let transactions fail in case of undeclared collections for reading. Collections for reading should be fully declared if possible, to avoid deadlocks. See locking and isolation for more information.

member.name: P:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoTransaction.Action
member.summary: The actual transaction operations to be executed, in the form of stringified JavaScript code. The code will be executed on server side, with late binding. It is thus critical that the code specified in action properly sets up all the variables it needs. If the code specified in action ends with a return statement, the value returned will also be returned by the REST API in the result attribute if the transaction committed successfully.

member.name: P:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoTransaction.WaitForSync
member.summary: An optional boolean flag that, if set, will force the transaction to write all data to disk before returning.

member.name: P:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoTransaction.LockTimeout
member.summary: An optional numeric value that can be used to set a timeout for waiting on collection locks. If not specified, a default value will be used. Setting lockTimeout to 0 will make ArangoDB not time out waiting for a lock.

member.name: P:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoTransaction.Params
member.summary: Optional arguments passed to action.

member.name: P:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoTransaction.MaxTransactionSize
member.summary: Transaction size limit in bytes. Honored by the RocksDB storage engine only.

member.name: T:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoView
member.summary: ArangoSearch View

member.name: P:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoView.Name
member.summary: The name of the View.

member.name: P:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoView.Type
member.summary: The type of the View. Must be equal to “arangosearch”. This option is immutable.

member.name: P:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoView.Links
member.summary: Expects an object with the attribute keys being names of to be linked collections, and the link properties as attribute values.

member.name: P:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoView.PrimarySort
member.summary: A primary sort order can be defined to enable an AQL optimization. If a query iterates over all documents of a View, wants to sort them by attribute values and the (left-most) fields to sort by as well as their sorting direction match with the primarySort definition, then the SORT operation is optimized away. This option is immutable.

member.name: P:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoView.PrimarySortCompression
member.summary: Defines how to compress the primary sort data (introduced in v3.7.1). ArangoDB v3.5 and v3.6 always compress the index using LZ4. This option is immutable.

member.name: P:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoView.StoredValues
member.summary: An array of objects to describe which document attributes to store in the View index (introduced in v3.7.1). It can then cover search queries, which means the data can be taken from the index directly and accessing the storage engine can be avoided.

member.name: P:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoView.CleanupIntervalStep
member.summary: Wait at least this many commits between removing unused files in the ArangoSearch data directory (default: 2, to disable use: 0).

member.name: P:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoView.CommitIntervalMsec
member.summary: Wait at least this many milliseconds between committing View data store changes and making documents visible to queries (default: 1000, to disable use: 0)

member.name: P:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoView.ConsolidationPolicy
member.summary: The consolidation policy to apply for selecting which segments should be merged

member.name: P:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoView.ConsolidationIntervalMsec
member.summary: Wait at least this many milliseconds between applying ‘consolidationPolicy’ to consolidate View data store and possibly release space on the filesystem (default: 10000, to disable use: 0).

member.name: P:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoView.WritebufferIdle
member.summary: Maximum number of writers (segments) cached in the pool (default: 64, use 0 to disable, immutable)

member.name: P:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoView.WritebufferActive
member.summary: Maximum number of concurrent active writers (segments) that perform a transaction. Other writers (segments) wait till current active writers (segments) finish (default: 0, use 0 to disable, immutable)

member.name: P:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoView.WritebufferSizeMax
member.summary: Maximum memory byte size per writer (segment) before a writer (segment) flush is triggered. 0 value turns off this limit for any writer (buffer) and data will be flushed periodically based on the value defined for the flush thread (ArangoDB server startup option). 0 value should be used carefully due to high potential memory consumption (default: 33554432, use 0 to disable, immutable)

member.summary: LZ4

member.summary: Arango View Consolidation Policy

member.name: P:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoViewConsolidationPolicy.Type
member.summary: The segment candidates for the “consolidation” operation are selected based upon several possible configurable formulas as defined by their types.

member.name: P:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoViewConsolidationPolicy.Threshold
member.summary: value in the range [0.0, 1.0]

member.name: P:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoViewConsolidationPolicy.SegmentsBytesFloor
member.summary: Defines the value (in bytes) to treat all smaller segments as equal for consolidation selection (default: 2097152)

member.name: P:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoViewConsolidationPolicy.SegmentsBytesMax
member.summary: Maximum allowed size of all consolidated segments in bytes (default: 5368709120)

member.name: P:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoViewConsolidationPolicy.SegmentsMax
member.summary: The maximum number of segments that will be evaluated as candidates for consolidation (default: 10)

member.name: P:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoViewConsolidationPolicy.SegmentsMin
member.summary: The minimum number of segments that will be evaluated as candidates for consolidation (default: 1)

member.name: T:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoViewConsolidationType
member.summary: Arango View Consolidation Type

member.name: F:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoViewConsolidationType.Tier
member.summary: (default): consolidate based on segment byte size and live document count as dictated by the customization attributes. If this type is used, then below segments* and minScore properties are available.

member.name: F:Core.Arango.Protocol.ArangoViewConsolidationType.BytesAccum
member.summary: Consolidate if and only if {threshold} > (segment_bytes + sum_of_merge_candidate_segment_bytes) / all_segment_bytes i.e. the sum of all candidate segment byte size is less than the total segment byte size multiplied by the {threshold}. If this type is used, then below threshold property is available.
